body_html:
Another thing I forgot to mention which I will add to that faq: Never use sudo to install with setup.py or with pip. All macs and linux computers come with a system python installed in /usr . This is the only python installation that requires sudo to install into, because it is dangerous to install new packages or change already installed packages of this system python. When you create a virtualenv, it creates a "new" python installation; this is much safer, as if you mess up your virtualenv you can just recreate it without breaking anything in your system.

Can you post more output of the error that you are getting?

Can you also post all commands you used to install, including the commands you used to create and activate the virtualenv? Also give the outputs of
which python
which pip
python --version
pip freeze | grep distutils
